channel.title: podcast BEIJING
channel.description:
Life and sounds in Beijing.
In this podcast, I record street sounds, interviews with taxi drivers and shishkebob selling guys on the street, stuff on the subway, and interviews with all kinds of people.
If you're having trouble listening, try some of these other links:
channel.itunes:author: tony comma
channel.itunes:summary:
Life and sounds in Beijing.
In this podcast, I record street sounds, interviews with taxi drivers and shishkebob selling guys on the street, stuff on the subway, and interviews with all kinds of people.
If you're having trouble listening, try some of these other links:

item.title: California, Beijing, and Lots of Singing
item.description: I've been off the air for over a year - wow! But I'm back. This episode contains recordings I made at a Native American Church meeting and Chinese people singing in a strange hotel/sanitarium in the suburbs of Beijing. Pretty random ...
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary: I've been off the air for over a year - wow! But I'm back. This episode contains recordings I made at a Native American Church meeting and Chinese people singing in a strange hotel/sanitarium in the suburbs of Beijing. Pretty random ...

item.title: live show in MONGOLIA
item.description: This episode is a live recording of a great show I saw in Mongolia.
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary: This episode is a live recording of a great show I saw in Mongolia.

item.title: THE MOVIE PITCH
item.description: This is the one with the movie pitch and other cool interviews...
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary: This is the one with the movie pitch and other cool interviews...

item.title: EASTER SUPER PODCAST
item.description:
This is one of my best podcasts ever. I had a BBQ party at my house on Sunday and recorded lots of singing, guitar playing, and everyone talked into the mic (must've been the beer). In this podcast, you'll hear Mandarin, Cantonese, English, Hindi, Spanish, French, Korean, Japanese, Mongolian, Shanghainese, Malay (or is it Malaysian), and one other Chinese dialect that I don't know the name of.
Enjoy!
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary:
This is one of my best podcasts ever. I had a BBQ party at my house on Sunday and recorded lots of singing, guitar playing, and everyone talked into the mic (must've been the beer). In this podcast, you'll hear Mandarin, Cantonese, English, Hindi, Spanish, French, Korean, Japanese, Mongolian, Shanghainese, Malay (or is it Malaysian), and one other Chinese dialect that I don't know the name of.
Enjoy!

item.title: BEIJING STARBUCKS
item.description: http://media.libsyn.com/media/english/dave_starbucks.MP3 PLEASE CLICK ON THE ABOVE LINK TO HEAR THIS EPISODE. This episode is an audio blog of a loooong conversation I had with my friend Dave. He lives in Korea, but he was here last weekend visiting ME! We went to Starbucks and spoke for a long time over a lot of coffee. We have two great ideas during this caffeine fueled talkfest. One is to make a podcast of Starbucks conversations and use it to teach people English. The other is to make a reality podcast called the Beijing Dating Challenge (or something similar … the idea is a podcast where one person chooses a new boyfriend/girlfriend by going on dates in Starbucks and gradually eliminating date contestants. The people listening to the podcast could vote and determine who moves on to new rounds).
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary:
http://media.libsyn.com/media/english/dave_starbucks.MP3
PLEASE CLICK ON THE ABOVE LINK TO HEAR THIS EPISODE.
This episode is an audio blog of a loooong conversation I had with my friend Dave. He lives in Korea, but he was here last weekend visiting ME! We went to Starbucks and spoke for a long time over a lot of coffee.
We have two great ideas during this caffeine fueled talkfest. One is to make a podcast of Starbucks conversations and use it to teach people English. The other is to make a reality podcast called the Beijing Dating Challenge (or something similar … the idea is a podcast where one person chooses a new boyfriend/girlfriend by going on dates in Starbucks and gradually eliminating date contestants. The people listening to the podcast could vote and determine who moves on to new rounds).

item.title: podcast BEIJING show twelve
item.description: This is a totally different kind of episode. This whole episode was recorded with a friend of mine in a real radio studio. I want to become the Howard Stern of China. This is the demo tape.
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary: This is a totally different kind of episode. This whole episode was recorded with a friend of mine in a real radio studio. I want to become the Howard Stern of China. This is the demo tape.

item.title: podcast BEIJING show eleven
item.description: In this episode, I play clips fro around town, including my friend Jonathan interviewing his mom in Mongolian, an early morning search for a store that sold sake, and getting stuck in traffic in a taxi.
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, I play clips fro around town, including my friend Jonathan interviewing his mom in Mongolian, an early morning search for a store that sold sake, and getting stuck in traffic in a taxi.

item.title: podcast BEIJING show ten
item.description: This is an all-fireworks episode! It's a very quick episode ... just street recordings of last Sunday's holiday and insane fireworks. It was like a warzone in Beijing, so I decided to record it.
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary: This is an all-fireworks episode! It's a very quick episode ... just street recordings of last Sunday's holiday and insane fireworks. It was like a warzone in Beijing, so I decided to record it.

item.title: podcast BEIJING episode nine
item.description: In this episode, I interview one of my co-workers and play some cool music by John Morley.
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, I interview one of my co-workers and play some cool music by John Morley.

item.title: podcast BEIJING show eight
item.description: This show is a little nutty. It's all recordings from a slightly drunken night in Sanlitun, the hip bar/club area in Beijing.
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary: This show is a little nutty. It's all recordings from a slightly drunken night in Sanlitun, the hip bar/club area in Beijing.

item.title: podcast BEIJING show seven
item.description: This is an all English, all live podcast. It was recorded on January 14, 2006, at a Mongolian bar in Beijing. There's live Mongolian music in the background, while I interview my friend Jonathan about life, politics, and the three themes of Mongolian songs (hometown, mother, horse).....
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary: This is an all English, all live podcast. It was recorded on January 14, 2006, at a Mongolian bar in Beijing. item.title: podcast BEIJING show six
item.description: interview with jingjing // interview with the shishkebob guy, with live english translation // morty and herta impersonators! // tony's thoughts on podcastin //
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary: interview with jingjing // interview with the shishkebob guy, with live english translation // morty and herta impersonators! // tony's thoughts on podcastin //

item.title: podcast BEIJING show four
item.description: This is my Christmas music show. Theres a few songs I like, and my girlfriend singing Rudolph The Red Nosed Reindeer in Korean while we ate Xmas dinner in an Indian restaurant in China.
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary: This is my Christmas music show. Theres a few songs I like, and my girlfriend singing Rudolph The Red Nosed Reindeer in Korean while we ate Xmas dinner in an Indian restaurant in China.

item.title: podcast BEIJING show three
item.description: This episode is a little mellower....there's some cool music by John Morley and some conversations I had with Chinese people.
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary: This episode is a little mellower....there's some cool music by John Morley and some conversations I had with Chinese people.

item.title: podcast BEIJING show two
item.description: In this podcast, I interview lots of people. I even interview my grandparents!
item.dc:creator: tony comma
item.itunes:summary: In this podcast, I interview lots of people. I even interview my grandparents!

item.title: podcast BEIJING show one
item.description: This is the first show. Me and some students (Vicki, Estela, and Fanni) in a car Shishkebob guy interview
